intro: Struthiola tetralepis var. glabricaulis, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed struthiola, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, smooth stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it is often found in open vegetation or along rocky outcrops. The variety glabricaulis is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to other varieties of Struthiola tetralepis.
